medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Ms. A experienced blepharospasm shortly after an abdominal surgery, with symptoms gradually increasing in intensity over several years, exacerbated by emotional stress. Ms. B's symptoms of blinking and inability to control eyelid closure developed six months after starting haloperidol, worsening under stress. Mr. C presented with excessive blinking and involuntary eyelid contractions that began two weeks prior, worsened by looking upward and anxiety.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Ms. A had good physical and mental health prior to surgery. Ms. B had a history of learning difficulties and psychiatric treatment since childhood. Mr. C had episodes of psychosis requiring thioridazine.
medical_history.family_history: Ms. B had a mother with mild late-onset diabetes; other family histories are not specified.
medical_history.social_history: Ms. A was a professional working mother. Ms. B was single, lived alone, and had worked as a secretary before leaving her job. Mr. C was single and came to the emergency room due to his symptoms. Specific lifestyle factors for Ms. A and Mr. C are not specified.
